medium: Brush and grey wash over black chalk

markings: Stamp in black ink, lower right: PM [in oval] [Lugt 3561]
inscribed:
in brown ink (partially erased), on mount, lower right: […] Collon;
in brown ink, on verso of mount lower right: Coll comte d’Auffay | 1809-1861

makers.displaymaker: formerly attributed to Francisco Camilo, Spanish, ca. 1615 - 1673

texts.textentryhtml: Alfred-Laurent-Joseph Le Poultier, comte d'Auffay [Lugt 63]; Mathias Polakovits, Paris and New York [Lugt 3561]<!--?xml:namespace prefix = "o" ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /--><o:p></o:p>

Engravings by Albrecht Dürer and other artists from northern Europe served as inspirations for Muntanya; the vertical composition he employed in this drawing is reminiscent of a woodcut by Dürer of the same subject. In Muntanya’s version, however, details of landscape and setting have been eliminated in favor of a focus on the figures.

bibliography.boilertext: Lisa A. Banner, Spanish Drawings in the Princeton University Art Museum, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Art Museum, 2012).
bibliography.citation: Lisa A. Banner, Spanish Drawings in the Princeton University Art Museum, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Art Museum, 2012)., p. 60, cat. no. 24; p. 61 (illus.)

bibliography.citation: "Acquisitions of the Princeton University Art Museum 2002," Record of the Princeton University Art Museum 62 (2003): p. 107-161., p. 118
